medical_history.chief_complaint: Infection due to NDM-1–producing Escherichia coli
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient developed dysarthria, blurring of the left eye, and tingling in the right upper extremity during a business trip to India in March 2009. He was admitted to a local hospital in India on 25 March 2009 with a diagnosis of Guillain–Barré syndrome and developed bradycardia, hypotension, and respiratory failure. He was intubated and mechanically ventilated. After being deemed stable, he was transferred to the intensive care unit in Japan on 4 April 2009. One month after the transfer, he developed fever, and blood cultures revealed two types of E. coli simultaneously.
